channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IL
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IL

item.title: Report E-2025030041
item.description:
Report E-2025030041

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-05T18:18:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-28
  • City: SAUGET
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On February 28, 2025, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN2922 was damaged and released approximately two (2) quarts of product to the trailer interior and concrete beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from ES+ to remediate the site. The crew utilized a cleaning agent and absorbents to remove all released product. All impacted materials and the damaged pail were containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2025030081
item.description:
Report X-2025030081

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-05T18:18:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-24
  • City: ADDISON
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: WAS NOTIFIED OF A HAZMAT PACKAGE TO BE PICKED UP AT BAY 441. WITH FULL PPE ON, SPILL CART, AND CURRENT DECISION TREE. UPON ARRIVING INSIDE THE TRAILER, SAW THAT THE HAZMAT PACKAGE HAD A FLAMMABLE LIQUID LABEL. CHECKED THE FLAMMABLE LIQUID HAZMAT AND NOTICED THAT THERE WAS SIGNS OF LEAKAGE, BUT RATHER THE SMELL IS COMING FROM THE INSIDE OF THE FLAMMABLE LIQUID HAZMAT. GRABBED THE FLAMMABLE LIQUID HAZMAT AND CONTAINED IT INSIDE A SPILL TUB. HEADED BACK TO THE PSC CAGE FOR FURTHER INSPECTION. LOOKING AT THE FLAMMABLE LIQUID HAZMAT, NOTICED THAT THERE WERE SIGNS OF THE HAZMAT BEING LEAKED ON FROM ANOTHER SOURCE ON MULTIPLE SIDES. WHEN OPENED THE FLAMMABLE LIQUID HAZMAT, NOTICED THAT THE CAPS WERE LOOSE AND LEAKAGE OCCURED.

item.title: Report E-2025030019
item.description:
Report E-2025030019

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-04T15:15:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-01
  • City: DES PLAINES
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SET Environmental was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, they observed an estimated (1) gallon of material released from one (1) 330-gallon plastic tote that was cracked at the top of the tote from improper preparation for shipping. SET Environmental personnel observed that the released material impacted 3 ft-by-2 ft of trailer and concrete dock floor. SET Environmental personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and containerized them along with the cut-up tote and PPE into two (2) 55-gallon poly drums. The remaining material in the product tote was to be transferred to two (2) 275-gallon IBC tote. Generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the Dayton Freight Lines team to coordinate disposal.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On February 25, 2025, one (1) 1-gallon can of paint was damaged and released approximately 1-gallon to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the site. All impacted materials were containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025020362
item.description:
Report E-2025020362

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-28T00:58:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-12
  • City: ROCKFORD
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one fourth (.25) of a cup of material released from one (1) 5-gallon metal pail due to improperly loaded freight that resulted in the pails being damaged. The five-gallon metal pail and plastic wrap that was around the original product was containerized it into one (1) 35-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.
